enable

public boolean enable(Context context,
                      java.lang.String appToken,

enable

public boolean enable(Context context,
                      java.lang.String appToken,
                      java.lang.String billingLicenseKey,
                      int cropMode)
This must be called to enable the SDK before calling any other SDK functions. It should be called as early as possible in the application flow as it starts downloading filter definitions as soon as it is called.

Parameters:
context -
appToken - Your app's token
appSignature - Your app's signature
Returns:
whether the SDK was enabled - this should only fail if the FilterDownloadManager service is not registered in the Manifest

appSignature - Your app's signature

launchPhotoEffects

public void launchPhotoEffects(Context context,
                               Bitmap image,
                               boolean doCropFirst,
                               R1PhotoEffectsSDK.PhotoEffectsListener callback)
Launch into the photo effects views using a bitmap. The bitmap should be resized to fit a 1024x1024 area before
calling this function, otherwise the scaling will be performed here and the resulting output will be scaled down as well.

Parameters:
context -
image - The bitmap to be used in creating effects, should have no side longer than 1024px
doCropFirst - if true, the cropping activity will be started first, otherwise the filter activity will be launched
callback - the callback used to handle the resulting image or to detect user cancellation

isDeviceSupported

public boolean isDeviceSupported(Context context)
Detect at runtime whether or not the device supports features used by the SDK. Features required are API level 9+ and OpenGL ES 2.0+

getScaledBitmap

public Bitmap getScaledBitmap(java.lang.String filePath)
This method creates the preferable size bitmap from filepath to avoid out of memory errors. It is highly recommended to use this method if you are passing large bitmaps to avoid memory problems in your application.

Parameters:
filePath -
Returns:
Bitmap size close to 1024X1024

getScaledBitmap

public Bitmap getScaledBitmap(java.io.File file)
This method creates the preferable size bitmap from file to avoid out of memory errors. It is highly recommended to use this method if you are passing large bitmaps to avoid memory problems in your application.

Parameters:
file -
Returns:
Bitmap size close to 1024X1024
